skill.name: comprehensive-code-review
skill.description: This skill should be used when reviewing pull requests, performing comprehensive code review, analyzing code changes before merge, or when the user asks for thorough/ultra-critical code review. Performs EXTREMELY CRITICAL 6-pass analysis identifying runtime failures, code consistency issues, architectural problems, environment compatibility risks, and verification strategies. Posts structured review as GitHub PR comment. Use when user asks to "review PR", "review this code", "review changes", "check this PR", "analyze PR", "post review", or for Phase 3 of devflow. Supports parallel review mode with multiplier (code-review-3, code-review 6X) for consensus-based reviews. This is an ultra-critical reviewer that does not let things slip and desires only perfection.

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill that provides code review methodology. It does not execute code or access external systems. The skill only reads git diffs and GitHub PR data through standard CLI tools for legitimate code review purposes.

low_findings.title: External command execution for git operations
low_findings.description: The skill uses standard git and GitHub CLI commands (gh pr view, gh pr diff, git diff) to gather PR information and code changes for review. This is legitimate functionality for a code review tool.

low_findings.title: Filesystem writes for review output
low_findings.description: The skill writes review reports to .reviews/ directory for local storage. This is normal behavior for saving review results.

content.user_title: Review pull requests with ultra-critical analysis
content.value_statement: Catch bugs before they reach production with systematic 6-pass code reviews. Get actionable feedback on runtime failures, architecture issues, and verification strategies.
actual_capabilities: Posts reviews directly to GitHub PRs
Creates Mermaid diagrams for visual explanations
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI for PR operations
Needs git repository with PR structure
Requires PR number for GitHub posting

use_cases.title: Pre-merge quality gates
use_cases.description: Block merging of PRs with critical issues by requesting changes with detailed technical feedback.

use_cases.title: Architecture review
use_cases.description: Identify refactoring opportunities, code duplication, and architectural improvements before code reaches production.

use_cases.title: Contribution validation
use_cases.description: Ensure external contributions meet project standards and properly implement all requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: code-review Review this PR and post findings as a GitHub comment

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Review
prompt_templates.prompt: code-review-3 Use 3 parallel reviewers for critical analysis

prompt_templates.title: Local Changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my local changes before I create a PR

prompt_templates.title: DevFlow Phase 3
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform Phase 3 review on these changes before merging

output_examples.input: Review this pull request that adds user authentication
output: The PR implements JWT-based authentication across 5 files:
- Current code accepts any JWT format without signature verification
Duplicate password hashing in 3 locations - extract to `src/utils/crypto.ts`

best_practices: Always provide the PR number when available for automatic GitHub posting
Use parallel review mode for critical changes requiring high confidence
Review local changes before creating PRs to catch issues early
Request specific fixes rather than giving percentage scores
anti_patterns: Do not approve PRs with any unaddressed issues - aim for 10/10 quality
Avoid reviewing without understanding the original issue requirements
Never skip the 100% requirement coverage verification
Do not post reviews only locally - always share on GitHub

faq.question: Is this compatible with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill uses standard GitHub CLI commands which work with GitHub Enterprise instances.

faq.question: What file types can it review?
faq.answer: Any text-based source code files including JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, Go, and more.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, you can run reviews as part of your CI process and fail builds on critical findings.

faq.question: How does parallel review mode work?
faq.answer: Launches multiple independent Claude instances that analyze the same changes, then synthesizes their findings for higher confidence results.

faq.question: Does it modify my code?
faq.answer: No, this is a review-only tool. It analyzes code and provides feedback but never modifies source files.

faq.question: How is this different from automated linters?
faq.answer: Provides contextual analysis beyond syntax - architecture review, requirement verification, and strategic improvement suggestions.
